member.name: T:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames
member.summary: Common mime types.

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationXJavascript
member.summary: Used to denote the encoding necessary for files containing JavaScript source code. The alternative MIME type for this file type is text/javascript.

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.AudioL24
member.summary: 24bit Linear PCM audio at 8-48kHz, 1-N channels; Defined in RFC 3190

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationXShockwaveFlash
member.summary: Adobe Flash files for example with the extension .swf

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationOctetStream
member.summary: Arbitrary binary data.[5] Generally speaking this type identifies files that are not associated with a specific application. Contrary to past assumptions by software packages such as Apache this is not a type that should be applied to unknown files. In such a case, a server or application should not indicate a content type, as it may be incorrect, but rather, should omit the type in order to allow the recipient to guess the type.[6]

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationAtomXml
member.summary: Atom feeds

member.summary: Cascading Style Sheets; Defined in RFC 2318

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.TextCmd
member.summary: commands; subtype resident in Gecko browsers like Firefox 3.5

member.name: F:ClimateCamp.Common.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.TextCsv
member.summary: Comma-separated values; Defined in RFC 4180

member.name: P:ClimateCamp.Application.ManualEmissionsCSVUploadDto.ActivityDataQuantity
member.summary:
For this specific case we agreed to set it to 0 unless we actually know it's value.
It's part of the classic/special differentiation mechanism.

member.name: M:ClimateCamp.Application.Common.EmissionsCalculator.CalculateEmissions(System.Nullable{System.Single},System.Nullable{System.Single},System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary:
Used to determine if there is already an emission calculation coming from the frontend.
If there is, then the emission property will not be null in which case the calculatedEmissions is the emision value.
Otherwise, the calculatedEmissions will be the multiplication between quantity and co2e factor.
